description: From Middle English enrollen, from Old French enroller.

verbs.description: enroll (third-person singular simple present enrolls, present participle enrolling, simple past and past participle enrolled)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To enter (a name, etc.) in a register, roll or list
(transitive) To enlist (someone) or make (someone) a member of
examples: They were eager to enroll new recruits.

entries.meaning: (intransitive) To enlist oneself (in something) or become a member (of something)
examples: Have you enrolled in classes yet for this term?
